label: Sinai Arabic NF M 8, Undertext (Greek majuscule)

note.value:
Reconstructed folio order, ff. 9r+46r (col. a), 8v+41v (col. a), 46r (col. b), 41v (col. b), 46v (col. a), 41r (col. a), 46v (col. b)+9v, 41r (col. b)+8r, 40v (col. a), 47r (col. a), 40v (col. b), 47r (col. b), 40r (col. a), 47v (col. a), 40r (col. b), 47v (col. b)

- original recto: 9r bottom+46r (col. a), 8v bottom+41v (col. a), 46r (col. b), 41v (col. b)
- original verso: 46v (col. a), 41r (col. a), 46v (col. b)+9v bottom, 41r (col. b)+8r bottom
- original recto: 40v (col. a), 47r (col. a), 40v (col. b), 47r (col. b)
- original verso: 40r (col. a), 47v (col. a), 40r (col. b), 47v (col. b)
(Rossetto)

Common codicological and palaeographical features suggest that the three Hippocratic texts and the two other medical texts in this codex ("Antyllus?, Recipes for different diseases" and "Treatise on medical terms") belonged to the same original manuscript (Rossetto)
Description of undertext by Agamemnon Tselikas, Nigel Wilson, Giulia Rossetto
